intro: Alipsa foliosa, commonly known as the leafy alipsa, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves that can reach up to 30 cm in diameter. Its showy, pentapetalous flowers are typically pink or red, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Alipsa foliosa is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its striking foliage and vibrant blooms.
